title: beer label font id
content:
Can someone id the font that is used for "ROOT BEER" and "NEW ULM, MINN"? Also, the font that is used for "AUGUST SCHELL CO.". Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124608im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture10_4572.jpg)
author: jjdewtt

comments.content: Talking about root beer. Does anyone know where I could buy root beer in Europe ? I've been searching for years, but no european distributor wants to even touch the stuff :-(

You’ll probably get close with Sackers Gothic or Engravers Gothic.

BTW, my brother lives in the (probably) original NEU ULM, here in Germany.

<cite>You’ll probably get close with Sackers Gothic or Engravers Gothic.</cite>

Are these both based on the same source material? I know Sackers Gothic has different weights but apart from that I haven't spotted the difference yet. I don't own either yet.

<cite>Talking about root beer. Does anyone know where I could buy root beer in Europe ? I’ve been searching for years, but no european distributor wants to even touch the stuff :-(</cite>

There is a fantastic Australian brand called Bundaberg, with very handsome labels, available in the UK. It seems that in Australia they call it by the old-fashioned name sarsaparilla, although it is labelled root beer here. However it looks as if the UK is the only European country they export too. Where are you?

[http://www.bundaberg-brew.com.au](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124608/http:/www.bundaberg-brew.com.au/)

You can buy it here!!!!  
 [http://www.sanza.co.uk/apps/shop/products/Bundaberg\_Root\_Beer\_\_\_(375ml\_bottle).asp?pId=7888](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124608/http:/www.sanza.co.uk/apps/shop/products/Bundaberg_Root_Beer___(375ml_bottle).asp?pId=7888)
Thanks so much everyone. Sackers Gothic will do the trick perfectly. Enjoy the root beer!
Thanx Justin, I'll give it a try ;-)
